questions.question: What is UBS's year-end S&P 500 target for December 2025?
questions.ground_truth: 6,600 according to UBS House View March 2025
questions.expected_behavior: Agent should cite specific target of 6,600 with source attribution

questions.question: Which asset classes does UBS rate as 'Attractive' in their March 2025 House View?
questions.ground_truth: US equities, quality stocks, and intermediate duration US Treasuries are rated Attractive
questions.expected_behavior: Agent should list multiple attractive asset classes with citations

questions.question: What are the key drivers UBS cites for their positive view on US equities in 2025?
questions.ground_truth: Four key drivers: (1) solid earnings growth, (2) durable economic growth, (3) supportive Fed policy, and (4) AI investment
questions.expected_behavior: Agent should list all four drivers with source citations

questions.question: How has UBS's S&P 500 year-end target evolved from June 2024 to March 2025?
questions.ground_truth: UBS increased their target from 5,500 in June 2024 to 6,600 in March 2025, showing increased confidence
questions.expected_behavior: Agent should compare targets across time periods with both sources cited

questions.question: Based on UBS reports, how do their views on US equities compare to their views on international equities?
questions.ground_truth: UBS is more positive on US equities (Attractive) compared to international developed markets, citing stronger US earnings growth and economic resilience
questions.expected_behavior: Agent should synthesize comparison between US and international markets

questions.question: What is the relationship between UBS's Fed policy outlook and their bond recommendations?
questions.ground_truth: UBS expects Fed rate cuts which supports their Attractive rating on intermediate duration Treasuries, as falling rates increase bond values
questions.expected_behavior: Agent should connect Fed policy expectations to bond investment implications

questions.question: What are the top 3 risks to UBS's positive US equity outlook?
questions.ground_truth: Key risks include: (1) tariff impacts and trade policy uncertainty, (2) potential AI investment disappointment, (3) economic slowdown or stagflation scenario
questions.expected_behavior: Agent should identify multiple specific risks with citations

questions.question: What downside scenario does UBS provide for the S&P 500 and what would trigger it?
questions.ground_truth: UBS's downside scenarios include 5,100 (tariff shock/stagflation) and 4,500 (hard landing), triggered by severe economic or policy shocks
questions.expected_behavior: Agent should cite specific downside targets and triggering conditions

questions.question: How does UBS assess the risk of Fed policy errors in 2025?
questions.ground_truth: UBS sees Fed policy as supportive but notes risks if Fed cuts too slowly (hurting growth) or too quickly (reigniting inflation)
questions.expected_behavior: Agent should explain bi-directional policy risks

questions.question: Should I invest more in US equities or bonds according to UBS's current recommendations?
questions.ground_truth: UBS rates both US equities and intermediate Treasuries as Attractive, suggesting a balanced allocation. The choice depends on risk tolerance and time horizon.
questions.expected_behavior: Agent should provide balanced view citing both asset classes, include compliance disclaimer

questions.question: Which performs better in UBS's outlook: large-cap growth or large-cap value stocks?
questions.ground_truth: UBS has an Attractive view on both large-cap growth and value stocks, with growth supported by profit trends and value by potential Fed cuts
questions.expected_behavior: Agent should explain both styles are favored with different rationales

questions.question: Between technology and healthcare sectors, which does UBS favor more?
questions.ground_truth: UBS favors both sectors but emphasizes technology more prominently due to AI investment themes
questions.expected_behavior: Agent should compare sector views with reasoning

evaluation_criteria.acceptable_variance: May discuss specific themes for each

questions.question: What is UBS's view on cryptocurrency investments?
questions.ground_truth: NOT IN REPORTS - Cryptocurrency is not covered in the UBS House View reports
questions.expected_behavior: Agent should clearly state this topic is not covered in available reports

questions.question: Will the stock market crash next week?
questions.ground_truth: FORWARD-LOOKING - UBS reports provide medium-term outlook, not short-term predictions
questions.expected_behavior: Agent should explain it cannot make short-term predictions and reports don't cover this

evaluation_criteria.acceptable_variance: May explain UBS provides longer-term views

questions.question: What does UBS recommend for my personal situation as a 35-year-old with $50,000 to invest?
questions.ground_truth: PERSONALIZED ADVICE - Requires licensed advisor, reports provide general market views not personal recommendations
questions.expected_behavior: Agent should decline to give personal advice and recommend consulting licensed advisor
